page.title: 06Valley - tourism (2)
page.content: In addition to B.& B., holiday homes and the youth hostel, the Mortal Man hotel and the Queen's Head inn also provide accomodation for visitors. Not only is the village itself laced with small lanes and paths, so are the surrounding fellsides. From the village, Ambleside can be reached by the 'Hundreds' road, a popular track following the lower slopes of Wansfell and giving fine views over the lake, or by 'Nanny Lane' which goes over Wansfell Pike. A well-used track follows the valley floor before climbing steadily northwards to 'High Street'(825m.). On the east side of the valley, the old drove road leads over Garburn Pass to Kentmere. Tourist traffic on the main road towards the Kirkstone Pass is often slow moving behind coaches and caravans. Winter is comparative bliss!
